projectPurpose: To serve as an educational tutorial guiding developers on how to build a simple LSM-Tree storage engine in Rust.
mainFeatures: Step-by-step tutorial for building an LSM-Tree storage engine
Covers core LSM-Tree concepts (memtable, SSTables, compaction)
Provides starter code and solution checkpoints

alternatives.name: Database Internals by Alex Petrov
mainFeatures: Explains database storage engine concepts (B-Trees, LSM-Trees)
Examines source code of open source databases

marketPositioning: mini-lsm is positioned as an educational tutorial for developers to learn the practical implementation of an LSM-Tree storage engine in Rust. Unlike production-grade key-value stores like RocksDB or LevelDB, its primary goal is knowledge transfer through hands-on coding rather than providing a ready-to-use database component. It serves as a code-centric alternative or complement to theoretical resources like 'Database Internals', specifically focusing on the LSM-Tree data structure.
